abstract: The 37 percent decline in Bank of America’s earnings reflects the persistent burden of Countrywide Financial, the subprime mortgage lender it bought in 2008.
snippet: The 37 percent decline in Bank of America’s earnings reflects the persistent burden of Countrywide Financial, the subprime mortgage lender it bought in 2008.
lead_paragraph: As big banks slowly shake off losses from the financial crisis, Bank of America provided another reminder on Friday of how hard it is to shed the legacy of the past.

headline.main: Mortgage Woes Stall Bank of America Revival
